author: Staff Reporter
text:
CITU National secretary A. Soundararajan said that the People's Welfare Front (PWF) has now emerged as the ‘most viable alternative’ to the corrupt AIADMK and DMK regimes.

“Our alliance have come together in a natural way to fight the common elements like eradication of corruption, prohibition, conservation of natural resources, welfare of farm and unorganised workers and prevention of honour killings,” he told reporters here on Thursday.

Mr. Soundararajan, who is also the CPI(M) central committee member and an MLA, said that around 80 per cent of people in the State now feel that it was imperative to have some alternative to successive AIADMK and DMK rules in the State for the last four decades because of the high scale of corruption.

Corruption

“Corruption is eating out the efficiency of the delivery systems. Common man is perturbed over the situation and he would end this soon by voting PWF to power,” he added.

Mr. Soundararajan expressed his concern over the delay in finalising the new slabs of wages for knitwear workers in Tirupur.

“It is sad that the knitwear unit owners are dragging on the wage talks despite the fact that the previous four-year wage agreement expired in January.”

He slammed the Union Government’s decision to reduce the interests on small savings like public provident fund and kissan vikas patra as well as setting 58 years limit to get the employer’s contribution of provident fund.

“These are anti-worker moves by the Union Government. They should have remembered that it was only the 'small savings mentality' that helped us withstand the economic situation arisen due to global meltdown,” he said.
title: PWF not an opportunistic alliance, says CPI(M)
